etymologies: mid 16th century. From Middle French, French mahaleb, †macalep, †macaleb from Arabic maḥlab, denoting the tree, its fruit, and the kernels of the fruit

definitions: The fragrant kernels of the fruits of a Eurasian cherry, Prunus mahaleb, which are used in perfumery; the tree itself (also called St Lucie cherry), which has hard scented wood and is used as a dwarf grafting-stock for cherries.
